instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
recieved this macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no visible corrosion
no green/orange light. no fan spin
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16.4v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>| L7030 0.149 1.0V
sometimes orange light shows but nothing changes on the voltage
(changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> twice)
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
pin: diode to ground | voltage
1 0.656 0.0v
2 0.601 16.4v
3 0.540 3.9v
9 0.726 0.0v
12 0.321 3.4v
13 0.501 3.3v
14 0.487 3.1
15 0.732 0.0v
17 0.147 1.1v
19 0.334 5.4v
20 0.330 5.4v
27 0.624 1.1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
You should have voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
With 0V at pin 1/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> is on; should have voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Change again <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and check all traces.
First be sure <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
after changing again <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>
now i got 12.2v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> 16v
still no green/orange light also no spin.
SMC issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Did you try another DCIN board?
Check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> te central pin of Magsafe connector.

Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
scl/sda 0.531 3.4v 
sorry i dont have extra dcin board
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP> continuity looks good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Do you get correct 12MHz oscillation at <SIGNAL>SMC_XTAL</SIGNAL>/EXTAL?
If no o-scope available, post DC voltage at least.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Looks good; not 100% sure (as o-scope), but usual DC levels, when Y5010 oscillates.

Check other voltages and signals of <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2) from page 39.
If good, then change SMC.

Once SMC is removed check continuity for its pads to surrounding components; especially for <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal.
